main event: A bright, reddish object, described as being in the shape of an electric light bulb, was reported over Valdosta, Georgia on 7 July 1949 by a woman who observed it for about 10 minutes before it slowly disappeared into the southwest.
interesting points: The object was bright red, hanging in the sky at a 45-degree angle from the horizon and appeared to be close enough to illuminate the neighborhood for about ten minutes.
Official weather records indicated calm winds and no scheduled aircraft flights or known transient flights over the area at the time of the sighting.
The witness, although considered trustworthy, was described as excitable and having a great amount of imagination, which raised some doubts about the sighting.
The general opinion of residents in Valdosta was that there is a Government Experimental Laboratory dealing with guided missiles located south of Valdosta, possibly contributing to the sighting.
The report was downgraded at 3-year intervals and declassified after 12 years according to DOD DIR 5200.10.
sighted object: bright, reddish object, described as an electric light bulb
